author: peter.davies
content:
I had a Lighthouse/Erigon node with the dodgy Erigon version. I had two issues:

Firstly, my client chose `0x2d0230d6a70a8ad017c0cb846fc931c8c8507a7677e48d5a2a4a208279ab3f4d` as terminal block hash at slot `3639557` and then proceeded down a minority chain with proposed slots at `3639558`, `3639565`, `3639582`, `3639588`. It then gave up on that chain at slot `3639620` and spent 7 minutes in the `Syncing Head Chain` state before doing a reorg with the correct terminal block hash.

Secondly, 12 hours later, Erigon started rejecting valid blocks due to aforementioned bug.

author: m.kalinin
content:
> and spent 7 minutes in the Syncing Head Chain state before doing a reorg with the correct terminal block hash.

The diff between gave up block (`3639620`) and canonical merge transition block is 63. It is likely waited for yet another 65 slots after that or lower, 65 slots is roughly 13 mins but in your case it was 7. This must be related to Erigon returned SYNCING on canonical transition block; while it was returning VALID on non-canonical ones. CL waits for 128 slots in this case before optimistically switching to the merge transition block -- this timeout is only applicable to a merge transition block

author: m.kalinin
content: Erigon staid at non-canonical terminal block because it had higher total difficulty than the canonical one
